title: Tough, thick and square
content: Searching for a thick, bold and square font for a construction co that works with young people on major recreational projects. I quite like this [http://www.sundogtours.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091117163745/http:/www.sundogtours.com/ "http://www.sundogtours.com/") to impart a cool yet strong feel.
author: Als02

comments.content:
The SunDogs typeface seems a bit too techno. Soft rounded curves don’t say ’tough’ to me.

Now [Ironmonger](http://web.archive.org/web/20091117163745/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/ironmonger/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DTough%2520mother%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D29) is a symbol of toughness.

Another would be [Force](http://web.archive.org/web/20091117163745/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/outras/force/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DTough%2520mother%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D20)

If you don’t like the slab serifs you could try [Tank](http://web.archive.org/web/20091117163745/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/tank/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DTough%2520mother%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D23)

Search “construction” and “military” at MyFonts.com for a pile of options.

_Soft rounded curves don’t say ’tough’ to me._

Maybe I’m substituting one cliché for another, but I wonder.  
How physical is construction these days?  
Digging holes with a backhoe is sedentary work.  
Power tools for everything.  
It’s the dance moves that keep David Hodo (Village People) so trim :-)
No bums on seats for this mob - perhaps that just how Nth American construction workers operate? :)

While I think any of our new Trilon designs would fit your bill, the [Expanded](http://web.archive.org/web/20091117163745/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/Fonts/#/TrilonExpanded) version may be the most appropriate.
